Generation VII.Sun: It feeds on the nectar and pollen of flowers. Because it's able to sense auras, it can identify which flowers are about to bloom.
Generation VII.Moon: Myriads of Cutiefly flutter above the heads of people who have auras resembling those of flowers.
Generation VII.Ultra Sun: Nectar and pollen are its favorite fare. In fields of flowers, it gets into skirmishes with Butterfree over food.
Generation VII.Ultra Moon: Cutiefly can pick up the auras of living things. It skillfully reads those auras to predict its foes' movements and make fools of them.

Generation VIII.Sword: Nectar and pollen are its favorite fare. You can find Cutiefly hovering around Gossifleur, trying to get some of Gossifleur's pollen.
Generation VIII.Shield: An opponent's aura can tell Cutiefly what that opponent's next move will be. Then Cutiefly can glide around the attack and strike back.

Generation IX.Scarlet: When it senses the auras of people or Pokémon who are having fun, it will draw close and give them a painful poke with its long proboscis.
Generation IX.Violet: Cutiefly sucks up pollen and nectar with its long proboscis. It stores any pollen it doesn't finish eating in its fur.

Generation VII.Ultra Sun: Routes 2 and 3 , Melemele Meadow , Poké Pelago
Generation VII.Ultra Moon: Routes 2 and 3 , Melemele Meadow , Poké Pelago

Generation VIII.Sword: Route 4 Rolling Fields , South Lake Miloch , Bridge Field , Hammerlocke Hills ( Max Raid Battle )
Generation VIII.Shield: Route 4 Rolling Fields , South Lake Miloch , Bridge Field , Hammerlocke Hills ( Max Raid Battle )

Generation IX.The Hidden Treasure of Area Zero: Kitakami Road , Mossfell Confluence , Wistful Fields , Paradise Barrens Tera Raid Battles ( 1★ )
